value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: How to solve Inactive Relationship Problem with Role Playing Dimensions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Role-Playing Dimension is one way of solving the inactive relationship problem in Power BI. Download the dataset for this example from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/userelationship-or-role-playing-dimension-dealing-with-inactive-relationships-in-power-bi

value.title: Parse JSON data in a column using Power Query in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this short video, I have explained how to pars a column that has JSON data.

value.title: Performance Tip for Power BI Enable Load Sucks Memory Up
value.excerpt: In the area of performance tuning a Power BI model, many things have to be considered, most of them around the consumption of the CPU and RAM. One of the most basic but important consideration is minimizing the usage of memory. By default, all queries from Query Editor will be loaded into the memory
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/cLcd-DLZC50" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Icon Names for Conditional Formatting Using DAX
value.excerpt: I have previously written about conditional formatting in Power BI, and how you can take one step further with using DAX to dynamically change the conditional formatting. Conditional formatting with DAX for colors is easy, you can use the color name or their hex code. But for Icons, it is slightly different.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UCLCQaVeshs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Subscription   Get Report Updates In Email
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered is it possible to have updates of the Power BI report to be emailed to you (or some other colleagues) on a daily basis? Power BI, fortunately, has this feature, it is called Subscription. Subscriptions are helpful ways to send an up-to-date version of the report and dashboard to
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/f_Y471pKWh0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Remove Digits or Keep them in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are a couple of useful actions that help a lot in cleaning data; removing digits, or keeping digits and removing everything else. In this short video, I’ll explain a simple method to do that using Power Query. Codes are in my blog article here: https://radacad.com/remove-digits-or-keep-them-in-power-bi-using-power-query

value.title: Set Different Levels of Access on the Same Dataset in Power BI using Row Level Security
value.excerpt: Learn how to set different levels of access to the users of the same report and same dataset in Power BI using Row Level Security. The dataset link is available in my blog post here:  https://radacad.com/row-level-security-configuration-in-power-bi-desktop

value.title: Showing an alternate text when no data available in a Power BI chart visuals
value.excerpt: If you have a visual in the Power BI, that based on some selections of a slicer it might return nothing, depends on the visual, you might get a blank visual or some other types of improper view. In this video, I share a simple trick that you can use to have an alternate message in those scenarios. Read

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.title: Trim Vs Clean in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: When applying text transformations in Power BI using Power Query; two very important transformations that can help are; Trim and Clean. These two mistakenly often considered to do one thing, but they are different. In this short article and video, I’ll explain their differences through an example. find

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.excerpt: Use a measure to filter slicer items instead of relying on bidirectional filters: you avoid calculation issues and improve the performance of your reports! value.title: Govern data across an enterprise
value.excerpt: Govern data across an enterprise

topItems.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
Manage Power BI assets by using Microsoft Purview
topItems.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Introduction to Power BI administration
value.excerpt: Introduction to Power BI administration

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

value.title: Add calculated tables and columns to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to add calculated tables and calculated columns to your data model. You'll also be able to describe row context, which is used to evaluated calculated column formulas. Because it's possible to add columns to a table by using Power Query, you'll also learn when it's best to create calculated columns instead of Power Query custom columns.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Enforce Power BI model security
value.excerpt: Enforce model security in Power BI using row-level security and object-level security.

value.title: Get started with data warehouses in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Understand the key components and design considerations for implementation of data warehouses in Microsoft Fabric.

value.title: Manage Power BI assets by using Microsoft Purview
value.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Design interactive data experiences with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Power BI enables report authors to produce interactive reports using visuals, slicers, bookmarks, and more.

value.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.

value.title: Establish a Power BI environment
value.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.
